item.title: Dragon Ball FighterZ Releases New Update, Getting New Fighter Next Year
item.description:
One of Arc System Works' longest-running fighting games is set to receive some major updates soon, with Dragon Ball FighterZ getting not only a balance update but a new character. The fighting game has been a darling among fans of both Dragon Ball Z and Arc System Works since it first released in early 2018. Dragon Ball FighterZ has continued to receive infrequent updates, releasing a new version of Android 21 in 2022 and launching a PS5 and Xbox Series X/S version last year. Now, even more new content is coming to FighterZ .

While Dragon Ball FighterZ has long since passed the peak of its popularity, the game has continued to be a popular choice for many fans. FighterZ would launch three different "FighterZ Passes" adding a variety of different characters to the game, including popular characters like Master Roshi and Broly alongside new forms like Goku (Ultra Instinct). Dragon Ball FighterZ also continues to be a mainstay at major tournaments, featured at nearly every EVO tournament since its release. A new update reveals that FighterZ is still kicking with another new character on the way.

Dragon Ball FighterZ Adding New Fighter Next Year

Arc System Works officially revealed some new content coming to Dragon Ball FighterZ during EVO France 2025, teasing multiple updates in the works. The developer revealed that a brand-new balance update will be launching for FighterZ , though specifics about the changes were not revealed. Arc System Works also surprised fans with the announcement that a new character will be coming to FighterZ next year, adding the Dragon Ball Daima version of Super Saiyan 4 Goku. SS4 Goku (Daima) is expected to release sometime during the Spring of 2026.

Super Saiyan 4 Goku's new version will mark the end of a long gap between new characters for Dragon Ball FighterZ . The proposed Spring launch date for the new version of Goku comes more than four years after the release of Android 21 (Lab Coat), who originally debuted in February 2022. His release is also set to mark the first new character added to FighterZ after the death of Dragon Ball creator Akira Toriyama, following his tragic passing in early 2024. Arc System Works has not confirmed whether SS4 Goku (Daima) will be part of a larger revival for FighterZ .

The newest character coming to Dragon Ball FighterZ comes as Arc System Works has kept itself busy with multiple new projects. Granblue Fantasy Versus: Rising has continued to add new characters to the game, with multiple new roster members coming in the second half of its "Season 2" series of DLC. The developer is also actively working on its next major project, teaming up with Marvel to develop Marvel Tokon: Fighting Souls as a crossover fighting game based on the comic book juggernaut. The new Dragon Ball FighterZ DLC serves as a testament to the game's longevity and popularity with fans.

8.8 /10

Dragon Ball FighterZ

item.title: PSA: You Don't Have to Wait Until 2026 to Play the Biggest Stardew Valley-Like Game
item.description:
There seems to be no end to cozy games these days, which isn't at all a bad thing given the relaxing, laid-back gameplay they offer. While games in general are traditionally viewed as a way for players to escape reality for a bit, cozy games go the extra mile by making that escape as stress-free as possible. And in an increasingly chaotic world, that kind of gameplay is coveted. As a result, the popularity of the cozy game genre has steadily increased, with games like Stardew Valley setting something of a standard for the cozy space and inspiring other titles to adopt and evolve the formula. One such title is Fields of Mistria , a farm life sim that is currently one of the best cozy games on the market.

Fields of Mistria has already been given a full release window of 2026, but the good news is that those who have been looking for another great Stardew -like to sink some hours into don't need to wait until next year to do so. The cozy game entered early access on Steam last August, and since then, it has achieved an Overwhelmingly Positive rating with nearly 18,000 reviews. It's not the first cozy game since Stardew Valley to accomplish a rating like that, but it is one of the few with such a large community of fans that has still managed to maintain such a noteworthy status. Much of this comes down to what Fields of Mistria already is, even in early access, but also what it does differently in the cozy genre.

What Fields of Mistria Is (And Why People Care)

As implied, Fields of Mistria is a cozy farm life sim RPG with plenty of dating sim elements that fans of games like Stardew Valley and Harvest Moon have taken a liking to since it entered early access last year. At its core, Fields of Mistria takes some of the cozy genre's most familiar mechanics — farming, animal rearing, mining, crafting, relationships — and puts them on the stage of a strong narrative and a unique magic system. In Fields of Mistria , players inherit an overgrown homestead in the quake-damaged village of Mistria and must restore the town while uncovering the land's hidden mysteries.

Fields of Mistria's features and systems:

  • Character creation and customization includes hairstyles, cosmetics, pronouns, appearance.
  • Four seasons and weather cycles that influence crop growth, forage, insects, fish.
  • Over 50 crops to plant and grow across seasons.
  • Animal raising and breeding, plus giving animals toys and dressing them.
  • Crafting, cooking, and blacksmithing, with hundreds of craftable items.
  • Museum with a collectibles system: donate fish, bugs, flora, archaeology finds, etc.
  • Underground exploration with combat, loot, and enemies.
  • Magic system which sees players gathering essence from tasks and unlocking skills and spells.
  • Over 400 items for home and farm customization.
  • Fully functioning town reputation system.
  • Over 30 characters with dynamic routines, and a gift, dialogue, and heart system.
  • Romance and heart events up to 8 hearts, with dating options and a best friend route.

Clearly, Fields of Mistria has all the ingredients for a great cozy game, but it's the fact that it has already become so popular in early access that makes it look like it could be the next Stardew Valley once it potentially increases its exposure with its full launch. Much of this popularity is due to the developer continuing to expand Fields of Mistria with major updates and content, including a massive Mines Update coming in early 2026 before the 1.0 release. And, as history has proven, it's that kind of commitment from developers that tends to strike a chord with fans, which could very well be what carries it toward an explosive full release next year.

Why Stardew Valley Fans Should Dive Into Fields of Mistria Now

With Fields of Mistria still being in early access and now potentially being less than a year away from its full release, some fans of games like Stardew Valley who are looking for their next cozy adventure might prefer to wait for Mistria 's 1.0 release. However, there are plenty of reasons to dive in right now while it's in early access.

Firstly, Fields of Mistria already has over 40 hours worth of content, which is more than enough for players to make a good investment into the game's full release. Secondly, the game is remarkably polished for an early access title, with its character writing, visual style, and smooth mechanics already earning high praise despite still undergoing development. And finally, again, the developer has been thoroughly committed to keeping Fields of Mistria updated through early access, and anyone who hops on the bandwagon now will get to experience the game's evolution firsthand, making its 1.0 launch all the more satisfying to witness.

10 /10

Fields of Mistria

item.title: Helldivers 2: Only 1 S-Tier Secondary Weapon is Virtually Unbeatable
item.description:
Meta may not be at the forefront of your mind in a PvE shooter. Still, metas truly do make a colossal difference in gameplay when you’re on Level 10 Super Helldive difficulty in Helldivers 2 . There’s quite an unmistakable disparity between the quality and effectiveness of some weapons, stratagems, and boosters, for instance, and, while you can have an enormous amount of fun with whatever build you’d like to role-play in, some will eclipse others.

This is the nature of a shooter like Helldivers 2 that is constantly grappling with balance and community feedback.

The game’s booster meta is clearly defined, for example, with four boosters that are instrumental and more OP than others. As for Helldivers 2 ’s secondary weapons, there are perhaps only a couple of S-tier sidearms, with the rest being a mixed bag that you or I may disagree on regarding their value. It seems there is a wide consensus affirming that the P-4 Senator is an S-tier secondary, for instance, but I’d die on the hill that the only secondary deserving of ‘S-tier’ status is the GP-20 Ultimatum.

No Secondary Outclasses Helldivers 2’s Ultimatum in Anti-Tank DPS

Secondary weapons are intended as backup sidearms that you can default to in a pinch, such as when doggedly pursued and without a second to spare reloading your primary weapon. In such cases, many players agree that the Senator crests Helldivers 2 ’s S-tier weapons, and I could genuinely see its merit, if not for how foundational and OP the Ultimatum is.

P-4 Senator Stats

  • Damage: 200
  • Capacity: 006
  • Recoil: 031
  • Fire Rate: 200

P-4 Senator Weapon Traits

  • Heavy Armor Penetrating
  • One Handed
  • Rounds Reload

GP-20 Ultimatum Stats

  • Damage: 3,000
  • Capacity: 01
  • Recoil: 031
  • Fire Rate: 900

GP-20 Ultimatum Weapon Traits

  • Anti-Tank
  • One Handed
  • Explosive

Call it a skill issue, but meticulously aiming or properly taking advantage of light, medium, or heavy penetration simply isn’t what I want to contend with when I feel like I’m firing an airsoft gun and ragdolled across a map. Either way, that’s why I equip the MG-43 Machine Gun stratagem on Helldivers 2 ’s Terminid and Illuminate planets, freeing my core build to focus wholly on mass destruction and objective completion.

I’d die on the hill that the only secondary deserving of ‘S-tier’ status is the GP-20 Ultimatum.

Helldivers 2’s Ultimatum Has S-Tier Utility

Before the GP-31 Grenade Pistol and the premise of mission-centric functionality, secondary weapons were completely forgettable to me, and I’d never bother unholstering mine for any reason. Few secondary weapons moonlight as an objective utility tool, and it’s these tools that have effortlessly eclipsed all other secondaries by contributing substance and viability to what sidearm I decided to equip.

Hundreds of hours ago, for example, I exclusively ran Helldivers 2 ’s Grenade Pistol, while my main primary was the LAS-17 Double-Edge Sickle, so that I could reliably close bug holes or implode bot fabricators. However, as soon as I came to the alarming realization that the R-36 Eruptor’s jet-propelled rounds can close bug holes and the Ultimatum can squash bot fabricators, it was an easy decision to graduate from them.

This also alleviates the need to delegate my throwable slot to a high-capacity inventory of basic grenades; rather, indulging fully in Helldivers 2 ’s anti-tank meta, I greatly prefer the DPS of the G-123 Thermite. Indeed, the Ultimatum may seem like overkill when I also equip the Eagle 500KG Bomb and Orbital 380MM HE Barrage stratagems, but I gladly accept the risk of being swarmed in ambushes if it means I can efficiently clear objectives with a handful of anti-tank explosives:

Helldivers 2’s Ultimatum Makes Quick Work of the Following Missions/Side Objectives

  • Anti-Air Emplacement
  • Blitz: Search and Destroy
  • Destroy Command Bunkers
  • Destroy Rogue Research Station
  • Intercept Convoy
  • Purge Hatcheries
  • Purge Illuminate
  • Mortar Emplacement
  • Shrieker Nest
  • Spore Spewer
  • Stalker Lair
  • Terminate Illegal Broadcast

The Ultimatum’s biggest disadvantage is that it only holds two rounds, though this can be mitigated depending on how frequently you’re able to loot ammo pickups or Hellpod resupply drops.

61
8.8 /10
9 /10

Helldivers 2

item.title: Best Open World Games With Romance
item.description:
Due to their nature, open-world games tend to have a larger scope than other types of titles. Smaller studios that make open-world games tend to focus more on making sure the combat, exploration, and other core aspects that make games enjoyable are perfect before fleshing out tertiary features.

Open-world games with larger budgets, on the other hand, have the luxury of making romance a core focus of gameplay, inviting players who are interested in forming long-lasting relationships with NPCs to fully immerse themselves in these worlds.

Cyberpunk 2077

Romance Hits Different in Night City

Cyberpunk 2077
6 /10
124
8.9 /10
Released
December 10, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Powered by

The four main romanceable characters in Cyberpunk 2077 are Judy Alvarez, Panam Palmer, River Ward, and Kerry Eurodyne. Judy and River are only interested if V, the protagonist, is a female character, whereas Panam and Kerry only jump in the sack with a male V. Other than that, players can also initiate minor, one-off flings with Alt Cunningham, Meredith Stout, Rogue Amendiares, and Ruby during the course of certain missions.

A key reason why romance in Cyberpunk 2077 stands out from a lot of other games is because it doesn't feel like an afterthought. Every potential romantic partner, even ones that are one-off flings, feel immersive, with storylines and progression that make in-game sense. The people in Night City feel real, and getting involved with them romantically is all the more meaningful because of it.

The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt

The Iconic Geralt, Yennefer, and Triss Love Triangle

The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt
9 /10
56
9.5 /10
Released
May 19, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Powered by

The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt has perhaps one of the most iconic love triangles in gaming, that being the relationship between Geralt of Rivia, Yennefer of Vengerberg, and Triss Merigold. As the main character, one of the toughest decisions Geralt has to make during the course of the game is which love interest to seriously pursue.

While players do have the option of romancing Yennefer and Triss at the same time, the results are decidedly catastrophic, which is why choosing a single partner and sticking with them is heavily encouraged.

Dragon Age: Inquisition

Open World Fantasy Love with Memorable Companions

Dragon Age: Inquisition
9 /10
13
8.2 /10
Released
November 18, 2014

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Powered by

Dragon Age: Inquisition continues a long-held tradition of the Dragon Age franchise by incorporating romanceable companions in the main gameplay loop. Depending on whether the players choose a male or female Inquisitor, the choices available to them are different, as the companions come with preferences of their own.

Each character has a fully voiced, lengthy romance sequence that plays out gradually over the course of a playthrough. Though players can initiate romance with multiple characters, they'll eventually have to choose one to see it through to the end.

Fallout 4

Romance is Locked Behind a Charisma Check

Fallout 4
9 /10
54
8.9 /10
Released
November 10, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Powered by

Romance plays a major role in Fallout 4 , as the game features multiple companions that can be pursued as love interests. Successfully convincing someoneto date the player requires passing Charisma checks, one of the main stats in Fallout 4 .

Initiating a romance requires building affinity, which can be done by performing actions that the companion agrees with. Piper, for instance, appreciates when the player is compassionate yet unyielding, whereas Cait prefers violence and selfishness. Depending on the type of build and the choices players make, the companions that will be interested in a relationship will be different.

Fable 3

A World Where Every NPC Might Just Be the One

Fable 3
8 /10
7.8 /10
Released
October 26, 2010

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

Powered by

The Fable games are infamous for giving players the ability to romance basically any NPC in the entire game, and nowhere is this system more fleshed out than in Fable 3 . To open up all romantic options, players will have to unlock the Friend, Lover, and Family expansion packs during the course of the story, each of them providing the hero more options in terms of how far they can take their romantic pursuits.

Character traits like sexuality factor into potential partners first, however, and NPCs that aren't interested in the player's gender as a whole will reject them wholesale. Marriage, divorce, and even children are on the table, provided players put in the time and effort to grind up to that level of intimacy and financial stability.

Greedfall

Flirting Your Way Through Colonial Intrigue

GreedFall
9.5 /10
Released
September 10, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Powered by

Greedfall is an open-world adventure game where players venture out into the world alongside their companions. The camaraderie they develop with these characters can blossom into romance over time, provided De Sardet, the protagonist, picks the right options in dialogue during key story moments, earning favorability with their party.

In terms of the mechanics of romance, Greedfall takes inspiration from games like Mass Effect and Dragon Age . Choosing favorable dialogue when talking to potential interests and completing personal quests is a requirement to progress this aspect of the game. Opportunities to flirt present themselves during pre-decided story moments, allowing players to choose who they want.

The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim

Nothing Says Commitment Like An Amulet of Mara

The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim
9 /10
82
9.5 /10
Released
November 11, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Powered by

Romance in The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim is a tad formulaic, though still worthy of note, thanks to the frankly insane amount of choices available in the game. Once players have accumulated enough goodwill with a romanceable NPC in Skyrim , they can wear an Amulet of Mara and talk to said character to propose to them.

If they accept, a marriage ceremony will be held in the venue in Riften, complete with guests, a priest, and a voiced sequence to tie the knot. Once the deed is done, players are able to move into their spouse's house, receive daily prepared meals, passive income, and the Lover's Comfort buff.

Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2

A Grounded Tale of Old-Fashioned Medieval Romance

Kingdom Come: Deliverance II
10 /10
75
9.0 /10
Released
February 4, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Powered by

Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 takes romance a step further compared to its predecessor, giving Henry more options in terms of who he can pursue as a love interest. There are five main romances in total, and players are gradually introduced to them over the course of the story.

Initiating a courtship with these characters will require earning their approval through quests and decisions, which will endear Henry to them and open the possibility of something more. On top of that, there are quite a few one-off romance encounters as well, most of which are only available during certain missions.

item.title: Diablo 4 Player Shares OP Necromancer Build for Season 10
item.description:
A Diablo 4 player online has shared their overpowered Necromancer build specifically created for Season 10. The build relies on a single button press to utterly destroy Diablo 4 enemies in every direction.

There are always overpowered Diablo 4 builds in every season, and the nature of new seasonal abilities means this meta is frequently changing. Often it's the unintended ways in which items and abilities interact with each other that cause these overpowered builds, and finding them is part of the fun. When a build is truly too overpowered, it can turn the gameplay into something of a power trip, which isn't inherently a bad thing, but it can make Diablo 4 trivial at times.

Diablo 4 Necromancer Build Abuses Power of Season 10's Chaos Perks

This Diablo 4 Necromancer build comes from YouTuber Rob2628, and uses the basic Bone Splinters skill as its main attack. They then take a legendary power which makes Bone Spirit fire Bone Splinters everywhere. Afterward, they combine this with Unstable Power, one of the new Chaos Perks introduced in Diablo 4 Season 10, which makes each Bone Splinter deal enormous amounts of damage. As Rob2628 shows in their video, if it steps onto the screen for even a moment, it dies - and that includes bosses, too.

Cooldown is obviously a problem with this build, but Rob2628 also has a solution for that. By using items with a Cooldown Reduction percentage and taking as many ranks of Rapid Ossification from the Necromancer skill tree as possible, they're able to massively reduce the cooldown. With all this in place, the speed at which this overpowered Diablo 4 Necromancer build can clear rooms is almost hilarious. They rarely even see the enemies, as they're already dead before they can come into vision.

Blizzard has already made some small balance changes in Diablo 4 Season 10 via updates, but up to now this particular Necromancer build remains unaffected. If it's found to be a little too powerful, it's always possible that it'll be nerfed in the future, but Necromancer players will be hoping this doesn't happen.

113
7.5 /10
9 /10

Diablo 4
